description:
U.S. Soldiers, assigned to 2nd Battalion, 12th Cavalry Regiment, 1st Brigade Combat Team, 1st Cavalry Division (Ironhorse), load tracked vehicles on rail cars at the 7th Army Joint Multinational Training Command's Grafenwoehr Training Area railhead station as part of exercise Combined Resolve III, Oct. 16, 2014. Combined Resolve III is designed to provide the Ironhorse Brigade with multinational training and partnership opportunities that will enhance the flexibility, agility and ability to better operate alongside NATO allies and partners in Europe. (Training Support Activity Europe | U.S. Army video by Visual Information Specialist Markus Rauchenberger/released)

Footage of Marines and Sailors with the 24th Marine Expeditionary Unit approach the USS Iwo Jima (LHD-7) on LCACs (Landing Craft Air Cushioned) off Little Creek, Va., May 23, prior to the start of Fleet Week New York 2011. Various units from II Marine Expeditionary Force have organized under the 24th Marine Expeditionary Unit to form the Special Purpose Marine Air Ground Task Force -- New York. The Marines are embarking on the Navy's Amphibious Assault Ships, the USS Iwo Jima (LHD-7) and USS New York (LPD-21) to take part in Fleet Week, May 25 -- Jun 1. The Marines will showcase the capabilities of the MAGTF, and also honor those who have served by participating in various events throughout Memorial Day weekend. Video by Cpl. Nicholas Gillen | 24th Marine Expeditionary Unit | Date: 05.23.2011

U.S. Marine Corps recruits of Charlie Company, 1st Recruit Training Battalion, and Oscar Company, 4th Recruit Training Battalion, met the drill instructors who will be responsible for transforming them into Marines on Parris Island, S.C. Although they were under the supervision of other drill instructors since their arrival on Parris Island several days earlier, these are the drill instructors who will be with them every moment for the next 12 weeks.

Footage of modern day Army Reserve paratroopers preparing for their jump on June 7, 2009. Under very rough rainy and windy conditions they along with 250 other paratroopers jumped into La Fiere, France to commemorate the historic jumps of 1944. Part 2 of 6.

An Operational Readiness Exercise conducted by the 102nd Intelligence Wing, at Tactical Training Base Kelley, Massachusetts, carried out a joint Army and Air National Guard downed pilot exercise with a UH-60 Black Hawk from the 126th Army Aviation Battalion and the 102nd Security Forces Squadron. U.S. Marines with Marine Heavy Helicopter Squadron 462 (HMH-462) perform an external mission as part of demilitarization at Kajaki, Helmand Province, Afghanistan, Oct. 7, 2013. HMH-462 used a CH-53E Super Stallion to pick up Marines, a civilian, gear and a High Mobility Multipurpose Wheeled Vehicle. Video by Sgt. Gabriela Garcia | 2nd Marine Aircraft Wing (Forward)

Pre-Commissioning Unit (PCU) America (LHA 6) amphibious assault ship returns to Ingalls Shipyard Jan. 31 from Acceptance Trials. During the trials, the ship’s main propulsion, communications, steering, navigational and radar systems were tested. Official U.S. Navy video by Mass Communication Specialists 2nd Class Ryan Riley. Courtesy Video | Navy Media Content Services

As part of the pre-deployment training of Combat Logistics Battalion 31, 31st Marine Expeditionary Unit, Marines from across the spectrum of military occupational specialties trained in the operation of the M240G machine gun and M249 squad automatic weapon systems. Operating on the ground as well as from High Mobility Multi-purpose Wheeled Vehicle turrets, 34 CLB-31 Marines honed their machine-gunning skills to remain ready for any contingency.

Aegis Ashore CTV-01 Flight Test - The Missile Defense Agency, the U.S. Navy, and sailors at the Aegis Ashore Missile Defense Test Complex and Pacific Missile Range Facility (PMRF), successfully conducted the first flight test involving components of the Aegis Ashore system.
